page.title: 14Home Life In Gunton.
page.content: Although widely scattered this appears to be a very stable community. Most of the elderly have lived in the same house all their lives with their pets,tending their gardens and usually keeping themselves very much to themselves. By nature very reticent they have little to say concerning education, religion or politics. The younger generation however are more vocal on subjects.They live in council renovated estate cottages or their own privately owned homes and enjoy leisure time in their village communities or nearby towns. The Norfolk dialect is still much heard among the elderly locals who lived peaceably with those who have moved from the towns. Within the Hall complex, because of their professional status (!) the residents are aware and outspoken on local issues.
